meanings.definition: gnars (verb): to make a harsh, grating sound
meanings.sent1: The old door gnars when it is opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate gnars loudly when it is pushed.
meanings.sent3: The gnarling sound of the car engine made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The gnarling wind outside the window sounded like a ghost's whisper.
meanings.sent5: The gnarling of the tree branches in the storm was eerie and unsettling.

meanings.sent1: The gnars of the metal scraping against the floor echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: The gnars of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with the gnars of students sharpening pencils.
meanings.sent4: The gnars of the brakes screeching startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: The gnars of the gears shifting could be heard from afar.
